snippet: Dennis M. Walcott, in a speech to administrators, will defend Michael R. Bloomberg’s record on issues like charter schools against harsh campaign criticism from Democrats.
abstract: New York City Schools Chancellor Dennis M Walcott is planning a campaign to remind voters of what he sees as Bloomberg administration's chief accomplishments, including rises in graduation rates and test scores; says he will call on mayoral candidates to put forth a compelling vision for city schools.

byline.original: By JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: Dennis M. Walcott, in a speech to administrators, will defend Michael R. Bloomberg’s record on issues like charter schools against harsh campaign criticism from Democrats.

headline.seo: Schools Chancellor to Strike Back at Candidates Critical of Mayor’s Policies
headline.main: Schools Chancellor to Strike Back at Candidates Critical of Mayor’s Policies
headline.print_headline: Schools Chancellor to Strike Back at Candidates Critical of Mayor’s Policies
